result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:44 pm - Defendant Justin R Gallegos in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Justin R Gallegos.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. Inducement contained in 08-22-22 email.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Further proceedings on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:33 pm - Defendant Justin R Gallegos in court.  Attorney Ann Larson in court for Justin R Gallegos.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Carl Knepel, Public Defender.

Initial appearance is reset to 08-15-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
2:17 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R Gallegos not in court. State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant.

Order Denying Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
Defendant should re-apply at the public defender's office.
Notice to defendant.

2:54 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R Gallegos in court.  PFAC filed with the court.  The court reviews and finds that there is nothing completed in the "income" section.  The defendant states that he is no longer employed.  Court suggests that he re-apply at the public defender before dealing with the PFAC.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Notice to defendant.

3:09 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R Gallegos in court.  Defendant has PFAC forms completed, but still needs to obtain denial letter from PD.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R Gallegos in court.  Defendant recently lost his job and is re-applying at public defender.  PFAC forms also given to defendant just in case he needs them.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-06-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

2:39 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Justin R Gallegos appeared in court. Defendant attempting to hire counsel.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 04-04-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1

Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
(given to deft in court on 02-21-22)

ADDRESS INFO for Justin R Gallegos
Current: 1112 S. 12th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-03-2022)
Prior: 1114 S 12th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Possess Fentanyl, on 01-28-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess fentanyl and possess THC-2nd offense.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-21-22 at  1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he not possess any controlled substances.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
